title: Sydney Indie Duo Lime Cordiale Announce Massive US Label Deal With, Um, Post Malone
text:
In news that is only ever going to make sense on Friday the 13th (the spooky day), Sydney indie-pop duo Lime Cordiale have locked down a massive international management and label deal with Post Malone, of all people.

The quietly impressive deal means that the brothers will be managed in the US by Posty and his manager, Dre London, who’s considered one of the biggest and best managers in the world at the moment.

Apparently it all happened by chance when Post Malone and London went along to a Lime Cordiale gig after being shown their summer indie jams by a mate, and the pair liked what they saw so damn much that they decided to sign them. Christ, imagine that.

It’s not hard to see why the US is obsessed with Australian artists when we’re putting out continuous golden hazy jams like this, really.

﻿

After rounding out their first-ever European tour – which had them selling out the O2 in London – Lime Cordiale quickly ducking over to the US to play a couple of shows at the end of September in LA and New York.

Then they’re coming home to kick off a huge run around Australia and New Zealand, as well as hitting up some of the essential summer fests like Lost Paradise, Spilt Milk, and Festival Of The Sun. Simply no rest for the wicked.

Peep all of their upcoming Aussie & NZ tour dates below if you wanna catch Lime Cordiale before they really bloody take off, which if Post Malone has his way, the world is now their fuckin’ oyster.

They’ve had to upgrade a few shows and announce some new gigs, which has them essentially doing residencies at The Triffid in Brisbane and The Corner Hotel in Melbourne. So cop a ticket over on their website.

Holy hell mates, this is such a huge – and delightfully weird – get. Well done.
